snippet: United Nations officials urged diplomats to cable their capitals to send money, doctors and protective gear to the affected region, while Doctors Without Borders called for countries to send biohazard experts.
abstract: United Nations and Doctors Without Borders each issue urgent appeals for international aid to contain Ebola outbreak in West Africa; more than 3,500 cases have been confirmed so far, with more than 1,500 deaths, making outbreak largest and most complex since disease was first identified in 1976.
lead_paragraph: United Nations officials urged diplomats to cable their capitals to send money, doctors and protective gear to the affected region, while Doctors Without Borders called for countries to send biohazard experts.

headline.main: U.N. and Medical Group Make Appeals for Ebola Aid
headline.print_headline: U.N. and Medical Group Make Appeals for Ebola Aid
